analyzed: skye tshe 'am yungs kar nag la rtsa ba'i sngags bskul ba dang bcas pa ci nus bzlas te yang blugs par bya'o //
translated: At the time of birth, one should pour it in, having recited the root mantra as much as possible, together with the recitation of the mantra of mustard seeds.

original: de nas rdo leb la rdo rje rgya gram bris pas kha bcad nas legs par sbas te /
analyzed: de nas rdo leb la rdo rje rgya gram bris pas kha bcad nas legs par sbas te /
translated: Then, having covered it with a stone slab on which a crossed vajra is drawn, one should conceal it well.

original: de'i steng du thab khung gru gsum du 'dug pa'i shing las me sbar la /
analyzed: de'i steng du thab khung gru gsum du 'dug pa'i shing las me sbar la /
translated: On top of that, one should light a fire from wood in a triangular hearth.

original: sha sna tshogs kyi spyin sreg nyi ma nyi shu rtsa gcig tu bya'o //
analyzed: sha sna tshogs kyi spyin sreg nyi ma nyi shu rtsa gcig tu bya'o //
translated: One should perform a burnt offering of various kinds of meat for twenty-one days.

original: de nas sha chen po'i spyin sreg nyi ma bdun du bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sha chen po'i spyin sreg nyi ma bdun du bya'o //
translated: Then, one should perform a burnt offering of great meat for seven days.

original: gsang sngags ni che ge mo grihn'a ma mi h'a m'a tri ga ne na h'um phat /
analyzed: gsang sngags ni che ge mo grihn'a ma mi h'a m'a tri ga ne na h'um phat /
translated: The mantra is: So-and-so, gṛhṇa mā mitra gaṇena hūṃ phaṭ.

original: ces bya ba rtsa ba'i gsang sngags kyi rjes su brjod pa ni sha'i spyin sreg gi gsang sngags so //
analyzed: ces bya ba rtsa ba'i gsang sngags kyi rjes su brjod pa ni sha'i spyin sreg gi gsang sngags so //
translated: The mantra for the burnt offering of meat is recited after the root mantra.

original: m'a tri ga na ba sham m'a n'a ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: m'a tri ga na ba sham m'a n'a ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Mā mitra gaṇavaśamānāya svāhā.

original: zhes bya ba rtsa ba'i gsang sngags kyi rjes su brjod pa ni dbang du bya ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rtsa ba'i gsang sngags kyi rjes su brjod pa ni dbang du bya ba'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra for subjugation is recited after the root mantra.

original: 'di ni sngon du ma mo dbang du bya ba'i spyin sreg la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sngon du ma mo dbang du bya ba'i spyin sreg la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied first to the burnt offering for subjugating the mātṛs.

original: de nas ma mo'i gdon gyis zin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas ma mo'i gdon gyis zin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, one will be seized by the mātṛ grahas.

original: gal te des kyang 'dzin du ma btub na sngags pa gcer bur byung ste /
analyzed: gal te des kyang 'dzin du ma btub na sngags pa gcer bur byung ste /
translated: If one is not seized by that, the mantrin should appear naked,

original: skra lhug par bshig nas /
analyzed: skra lhug par bshig nas /
translated: his hair loose,

original: lus khrag sna tshogs kyis bskus te /
analyzed: lus khrag sna tshogs kyis bskus te /
translated: his body smeared with various bloods,

original: gdong shin tu bsgyur bas gsang sngags zlos shing g-yon brkyang ba'i stabs kyis thod pa mnan te ;
analyzed: gdong shin tu bsgyur bas gsang sngags zlos shing g-yon brkyang ba'i stabs kyis thod pa mnan te ;
translated: his face greatly distorted, reciting the mantra, pressing down the skull with the left leg extended,

original: / sems rab tu khros pas gshin rje gshed po'i skur bsgoms nas /
analyzed: / sems rab tu khros pas gshin rje gshed po'i skur bsgoms nas /
translated: his mind greatly enraged, visualizing himself in the form of Yamāntaka.

original: 'di lta bu'i sbyor ba nyi ma bdun gyis de ma mo'i gdon gyis zin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sbyor ba nyi ma bdun gyis de ma mo'i gdon gyis zin par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this practice, in seven days he will be seized by the mātṛ grahas.

original: tha ma rnams kyang zla ba drug gis zin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha ma rnams kyang zla ba drug gis zin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even the lowest will be seized in six months.

original: phyis las grub par gyur nas de dag phyung ste 'o mas bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyis las grub par gyur nas de dag phyung ste 'o mas bkru bar bya'o //
translated: Later, when the rite is accomplished, they should be released and washed with milk.

original: sbu gu rig pa'i cho ga las /
analyzed: sbu gu rig pa'i cho ga las /
translated: From the ritual of the tube knowledge,

original: bsgrub bya ma mo'i gdon gyis zin par bya ba'i sbyor ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: bsgrub bya ma mo'i gdon gyis zin par bya ba'i sbyor ba rdzogs so /
translated: The procedure for being possessed by the mātṛkā spirit to be accomplished is complete.

original: // / da ni sbu gu rig par bya ba'i cho ga dang / bsgrub bya smyo 'dres zin par bya ba'i sbyor ba bshad de /
analyzed: // / da ni sbu gu rig par bya ba'i cho ga dang / bsgrub bya smyo 'dres zin par bya ba'i sbyor ba bshad de /
translated: Now, the procedure for the knowledge of the tube and the procedure for being possessed by the spirit of insanity to be accomplished are explained.

original: dang po sngags pa bdag nyid kyis rdo rje dkyil 'khor legs par brtan par bsgoms shing @22b gsang sngags legs par bzlas te drod thob par byas nas de nas bsgrub bya'i ling+ga snga ma bzhin byas te /
analyzed: dang po sngags pa bdag nyid kyis rdo rje dkyil 'khor legs par brtan par bsgoms shing @22b gsang sngags legs par bzlas te drod thob par byas nas de nas bsgrub bya'i ling+ga snga ma bzhin byas te /
translated: First, the mantrin himself should meditate well on the vajra maṇḍala, recite the mantra well, and attain heat. Then, having made the victim’s corpse as before,

original: 'byung po smyo 'dre gnas pa'i sar song nas shing leb dkar po bzang po zhig la /
analyzed: 'byung po smyo 'dre gnas pa'i sar song nas shing leb dkar po bzang po zhig la /
translated: he should go to a place where the spirit of insanity resides and, on a good, white wooden board,

original: rtse mo ngos su smyo 'dre kha dog dkar po la lag na shing ring ri mo sna tshogs pa thogs shing gar byed pa bzhin mtshal gyis byugs shing brkos pa /
analyzed: rtse mo ngos su smyo 'dre kha dog dkar po la lag na shing ring ri mo sna tshogs pa thogs shing gar byed pa bzhin mtshal gyis byugs shing brkos pa /
translated: on the upper side, with vermilion, he should draw the spirit of insanity, white in color, with hands holding a long stick with various designs, dancing,

original: snying ga nas yi ge bhu zhes bya ba gnas pa zhig bri'o //
analyzed: snying ga nas yi ge bhu zhes bya ba gnas pa zhig bri'o //
translated: and with the syllable bhu residing in the heart.

original: sba ba'i rtsar bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan skud pa nag pos shing leb dang bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: sba ba'i rtsar bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan skud pa nag pos shing leb dang bcing bar bya'o //
translated: At the root of the tree, one should bind the effigy of the victim with black thread to a wooden board.

original: bsgrub bya'i lte ba'i tshon skud 'byung po'i rkang pa la gu gul gyis sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i lte ba'i tshon skud 'byung po'i rkang pa la gu gul gyis sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should attach the colored thread of the victim’s navel to the foot of the spirit with bdellium.

original: de nas shing leb de dong du bcug ste legs par kha gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas shing leb de dong du bcug ste legs par kha gcad par bya'o //
translated: Then, having placed that wooden board in a pit, one should cover it well.

original: de'i steng du thab khung zla gam byas te /
analyzed: de'i steng du thab khung zla gam byas te /
translated: On top of that, one should make a triangular hearth.

original: shing sna tshogs la me spar nas kha zas sna tshogs kyi spyin sreg byas te /
analyzed: shing sna tshogs la me spar nas kha zas sna tshogs kyi spyin sreg byas te /
translated: Having lit a fire of various woods, one should offer a burnt offering of various foods.

original: gsang sngags he ma h'a bh'u ta che ge mo zhes bya ba ai dam du sht'am grihna h'um phat /
analyzed: gsang sngags he ma h'a bh'u ta che ge mo zhes bya ba ai dam du sht'am grihna h'um phat /
translated: One should recite the mantra “He mahābhūta so-and-so, I demand the flesh and blood of such-and-such, hūṃ phaṭ!”

original: ces bya ba rtsa ba'i gsang sngags kyi rjes su bskul bas spyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba rtsa ba'i gsang sngags kyi rjes su bskul bas spyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should perform the burnt offering by inciting with the root mantra.

original: 'di yang snga ma bzhin du zhag bdun nam zla ba drug gis 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di yang snga ma bzhin du zhag bdun nam zla ba drug gis 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: Also, as before, within seven days or six months, one will be seized.

original: gal te sgrub pa po sems stobs chung ba'i dbang gis des 'dzin du ma btub na de phyin chad kyang 'dzin par mi byed do //
analyzed: gal te sgrub pa po sems stobs chung ba'i dbang gis des 'dzin du ma btub na de phyin chad kyang 'dzin par mi byed do //
translated: If the practitioner is unable to hold it due to the weakness of his mind, he should not hold it from then on.

original: sgrub pa po nyid kyang bkra mi shis par byed do //
analyzed: sgrub pa po nyid kyang bkra mi shis par byed do //
translated: The practitioner himself will also be inauspicious.

original: sbu gu rig par bya ba zhes bya ba'i cho ga las /
analyzed: sbu gu rig par bya ba zhes bya ba'i cho ga las /
translated: From the ritual called The Knowledge of the Tube,

original: bsgrub bya 'byung po smyo 'dres zin par bya ba'i sbyor ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: bsgrub bya 'byung po smyo 'dres zin par bya ba'i sbyor ba rdzogs so /
translated: the method of causing the possessed being to be seized by a spirit of insanity is complete.

original: // / gdon chen po bzhi po 'di dag kyang sgrub pa pos spyin sreg dang mchod pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas mgu bar gyur pas sgrub pa po la phan 'dogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: // / gdon chen po bzhi po 'di dag kyang sgrub pa pos spyin sreg dang mchod pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas mgu bar gyur pas sgrub pa po la phan 'dogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: These four great spirits, when pleased by the practitioner through such means as burnt offerings and worship, not only benefit the practitioner,

original: 'di ltar klu'i gdon ni phra mo'i sgo nas gzhan la gnod pa'i las byed do //🔽sa'i gdon ni brnab sems dang phrag dog gi sgo nas gzhan la gnod pa'i sbyor ba byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar klu'i gdon ni phra mo'i sgo nas gzhan la gnod pa'i las byed do // sa'i gdon ni brnab sems dang phrag dog gi sgo nas gzhan la gnod pa'i sbyor ba byed do //
translated: but also, in this way, the nāga spirit harms others through subtle means.🔽The earth spirit engages in harming others through covetousness and jealousy.

original: ma mo'i gdon ni chags sems kyi sgo nas gzhan la gnod pa'i sbyor ba byed do //
analyzed: ma mo'i gdon ni chags sems kyi sgo nas gzhan la gnod pa'i sbyor ba byed do //
translated: The mātṛ spirit engages in harming others through attachment.

original: 'byung po'i gdon ni gnod sems kyi sgo nas gzhan la gnod pa'i sbyor ba byed de /
analyzed: 'byung po'i gdon ni gnod sems kyi sgo nas gzhan la gnod pa'i sbyor ba byed de /
translated: The bhūta grahas harm others through malice.

original: de bas na gdon chen po 'di dag las myur bar byed pa yin yang las rtag tu brtan par byed pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de bas na gdon chen po 'di dag las myur bar byed pa yin yang las rtag tu brtan par byed pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, these great grahas act quickly, but they are not always stable in their actions.

original: sgrub pa po bkra shis par byed pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: sgrub pa po bkra shis par byed pa yang ma yin /
translated: They are not auspicious for the practitioner.

original: 'on kyang bye brag ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bye brag ni yod pa yin te /
translated: However, there are differences.

original: 'byung po ni blo sna tshogs can te des legs pa brtan par mi byed do //🔽sa bdag ni rang 'dzin can te 'grogs na bde @23a * //
analyzed: 'byung po ni blo sna tshogs can te des legs pa brtan par mi byed do // sa bdag ni rang 'dzin can te 'grogs na bde @23a * //
translated: The bhūtas have various thoughts and do not act with stability.

original: bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The pūtanas are self-centered and are not pleasant to be with.

original: klu ni blun zhing rgyud gcig pa ste /
analyzed: klu ni blun zhing rgyud gcig pa ste /
translated: The nāgas are stupid and single-minded.

original: thog mar 'dris shing dga' bar 'gyur ba dka' ba'o //
analyzed: thog mar 'dris shing dga' bar 'gyur ba dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to make friends with them and to please them.

original: ma mo ni dga' che ba ste /
analyzed: ma mo ni dga' che ba ste /
translated: The yakṣiṇīs are very passionate.

original: rtag tu de'i sems gzung bar dka'o //
analyzed: rtag tu de'i sems gzung bar dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to always keep their minds.

original: de bas na sgrub pa po rnams kyis rang gi nus pa dang sbyar te cho ga rnams la sbyar par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sgrub pa po rnams kyis rang gi nus pa dang sbyar te cho ga rnams la sbyar par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the practitioner should apply the rites according to his own ability.

original: sbu gu rig pa zhes bya ba'i thabs kyi cho ga sbyor ba dang bcas pa bstan pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sbu gu rig pa zhes bya ba'i thabs kyi cho ga sbyor ba dang bcas pa bstan pa rdzogs so /
translated: The method ritual called “the tube awareness” has been taught together with the practice.

original: // / de nas gnad rnams gzir ba yi //
analyzed: // / de nas gnad rnams gzir ba yi //
translated: Then, the ritual of pressing the vital points

original: cho ga yang ni bshad par bya //
analyzed: cho ga yang ni bshad par bya //
translated: should be explained.

original: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor bsgom byas te //
analyzed: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor bsgom byas te //
translated: Having meditated on the vajra maṇḍala

original: gsang sngags tshul bzhin bzlas byas nas //
analyzed: gsang sngags tshul bzhin bzlas byas nas //
translated: and recited the mantra according to the rules,

original: yi dam bcas pa rdzogs nas kyang //
analyzed: yi dam bcas pa rdzogs nas kyang //
translated: having completed the pledge of the deity,

original: dur khrod la sogs song nas ni //🔽phur bu dpal rtse mdung la sogs //
analyzed: dur khrod la sogs song nas ni // phur bu dpal rtse mdung la sogs //
translated: one should go to a charnel ground, and so on.

original: khrag chen gyis ni bskus nas kyang //
analyzed: khrag chen gyis ni bskus nas kyang //
translated: Having anointed with great blood🔽a kīla, a glorious peak, a spear, and so on,

original: gu gul nag pos bdug par bya //
analyzed: gu gul nag pos bdug par bya //
translated: one should fumigate it with black gugul.

original: rus pa dag gi rgyan yang gdags //
analyzed: rus pa dag gi rgyan yang gdags //
translated: One should also place ornaments of bone.

original: mandala khrag gis byugs pa yi //
analyzed: mandala khrag gis byugs pa yi //
translated: Having anointed a maṇḍala with blood,

original: steng du legs par gzugs par bya //
analyzed: steng du legs par gzugs par bya //
translated: one should place it well on top.🔽Having offered lamps

original: mi yi tshil las byas pa yi//🔽mar me dag kyang phul nas ni //
analyzed: mi yi tshil las byas pa yi// mar me dag kyang phul nas ni //
translated: made of human fat,

original: me tog nag po gtor nas kyang //
analyzed: me tog nag po gtor nas kyang //
translated: and having scattered black flowers,

original: de nas gsang sngags bzlas pa brtsam //
analyzed: de nas gsang sngags bzlas pa brtsam //
translated: one should then begin to recite the mantra.

original: gal te grub par gyur na ni //
analyzed: gal te grub par gyur na ni //
translated: If one becomes accomplished,

original: de ni dngos grub can du 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni dngos grub can du 'gyur //
translated: one will become a siddha.

original: grub pa dag tu ma gyur kyang //
analyzed: grub pa dag tu ma gyur kyang //
translated: Even if they are not accomplished,

original: mnan rnams gzir bar gdon mi za //
analyzed: mnan rnams gzir bar gdon mi za //
translated: there is no doubt that the oppressed will be tormented.

original: mnan dang gzir ba'i thabs kyi cho ga ni 'di yin te ;
analyzed: mnan dang gzir ba'i thabs kyi cho ga ni 'di yin te ;
translated: The ritual method of subduing and tormenting is as follows:

original: dang por sngags pas bsnyen pa'i cho ga ji ltar nus pa bzhin du byas te /
analyzed: dang por sngags pas bsnyen pa'i cho ga ji ltar nus pa bzhin du byas te /
translated: First, the mantrin should perform the approach ritual as much as possible.

original: ji ltar rang gi dam bcas pa rdzogs par gyur pa dang / nag po'i phyogs kyi tshes brgyad dam bcu bzhi la dur khrod la sogs pa'i gnas su song ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi dam bcas pa rdzogs par gyur pa dang / nag po'i phyogs kyi tshes brgyad dam bcu bzhi la dur khrod la sogs pa'i gnas su song ste /
translated: When one's vow is fulfilled, on the eighth or fourteenth day of the dark lunar fortnight, one should go to a charnel ground or similar place,

original: khrag gis bsgos pa'i mandala gru gsum zhig byas nas /
analyzed: khrag gis bsgos pa'i mandala gru gsum zhig byas nas /
translated: and make a triangular maṇḍala stained with blood.

original: der phur bu 'am rtsang chen nam /
analyzed: der phur bu 'am rtsang chen nam /
translated: There, one should place either a kīla, a great arrow,

original: mdung thung rnams bzo bo mkhas pas legs par byas pa gang yang rung ba lnga 'am dgu gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: mdung thung rnams bzo bo mkhas pas legs par byas pa gang yang rung ba lnga 'am dgu gzhag par bya'o //
translated: or a javelin, well-made by a skilled craftsman, either five or nine of any kind.

original: de'i phyi rol du lcags kyi tsher ma 'am /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du lcags kyi tsher ma 'am /
translated: Outside of that, one should also place iron thorns,

original: po son cha'i tsher ma 'am gdug pa rnams la dug dang khrag gis bsgos pa'ang gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: po son cha'i tsher ma 'am gdug pa rnams la dug dang khrag gis bsgos pa'ang gzhag par bya'o //
translated: or poisonous thorns, smeared with poison and blood.

original: phur bu la sogs pa gang yod pa de la khrag chen pos bskus te /
analyzed: phur bu la sogs pa gang yod pa de la khrag chen pos bskus te /
translated: Whatever is available, such as a kīla, is anointed with great blood.

original: mi rus kyi rgyan yang gdags shing /
analyzed: mi rus kyi rgyan yang gdags shing /
translated: Also, ornaments of human bone are attached.

original: gu gul nag po'i spos kyis kyang bdugs te gzhag go //
analyzed: gu gul nag po'i spos kyis kyang bdugs te gzhag go //
translated: Also, black gugul incense is burned and placed.

original: phyogs rnams su yang tshil chen po'i mar me dang / me tog dug gis bsgos pa dang / chang dang mi'i khrag sbyar pa'i aargha dang / khrag @23b sna tshogs dang sbyar ba'i gtor ma rnams kyang gzhag go //
analyzed: phyogs rnams su yang tshil chen po'i mar me dang / me tog dug gis bsgos pa dang / chang dang mi'i khrag sbyar pa'i aargha dang / khrag @23b sna tshogs dang sbyar ba'i gtor ma rnams kyang gzhag go //
translated: Also, in the directions, one should place lamps of great fat, flowers smeared with poison, argha mixed with alcohol and human blood, and bali mixed with various kinds of blood.

original: de nas sngags pa bdag nyid gos nag po gon skra lhug par bshig ste /
analyzed: de nas sngags pa bdag nyid gos nag po gon skra lhug par bshig ste /
translated: Then the mantrin himself, wearing black clothes and loosening his hair,

original: lag pa khrag gis bskus nas rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor ji lta ba bzhin bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa khrag gis bskus nas rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor ji lta ba bzhin bsgom par bya'o //
translated: anoints his hands with blood and meditates on the vajra maṇḍala just as it is.

original: de nas khro bo gshin rje gshed po yang mtshon cha la spyan drangs te mchod par bya'o /
analyzed: de nas khro bo gshin rje gshed po yang mtshon cha la spyan drangs te mchod par bya'o /
translated: Then one should invite the wrathful Yamāntaka to the weapon and make offerings.

original: yang na mtshon cha de dag la spyin sreg gis kyang mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na mtshon cha de dag la spyin sreg gis kyang mchod par bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, one should make offerings to those weapons with a fire offering.

original: de nas mtshon cha de'i spyi bor nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du /
analyzed: de nas mtshon cha de'i spyi bor nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du /
translated: Then, on the top of that weapon, on a sun maṇḍala,

original: yi ge ya 'od 'bar ba kha dog nag bo zhig bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge ya 'od 'bar ba kha dog nag bo zhig bsgom par bya'o //
translated: meditate on a blazing, black syllable ya.

original: de'i rked pa la shar phyogs su ksha dkar po /🔽lho phyogs su ma ser po /
analyzed: de'i rked pa la shar phyogs su ksha dkar po / lho phyogs su ma ser po /
translated: On its waist, in the east, is a white kṣa;🔽in the south, a yellow ma;

original: nub phyogs su me dmar po /
analyzed: nub phyogs su me dmar po /
translated: in the west, a red me;

original: byang phyogs su da ljang gu /
analyzed: byang phyogs su da ljang gu /
translated: in the north, a green da.

original: de dag kyang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa 'od 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa 'od 'bar ba'o //
translated: Those are also blazing lights abiding in sun maṇḍalas.

original: rtse mo'i cha la shar phyogs su ya dkar po /
analyzed: rtse mo'i cha la shar phyogs su ya dkar po /
translated: On the tip, in the east, is a white ya;

original: lho phyogs su tstsha ser po /
analyzed: lho phyogs su tstsha ser po /
translated: in the south, a yellow cha;

original: nub phyogs su ni dmar po /
analyzed: nub phyogs su ni dmar po /
translated: in the west, a red na;

original: byang phyogs su ra ljang gu /
analyzed: byang phyogs su ra ljang gu /
translated: in the north, a green ra.

original: de dag kyang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa 'od 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa 'od 'bar ba'o //
translated: Those are also blazing lights abiding in sun maṇḍalas.

original: rtse mo nyid du phat nag po 'od 'bar ba bsam ste /
analyzed: rtse mo nyid du phat nag po 'od 'bar ba bsam ste /
translated: At the very tip, imagine a blazing black phaṭ.

original: mtshon cha de dag kyang shin tu gzi byin dang ldan par byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshon cha de dag kyang shin tu gzi byin dang ldan par byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: Those weapons should be empowered as extremely majestic.

original: de nas sngags pa bdag nyid rtsa ba'i gsang sngags ji lta ba bzhin du brjod pas bskul bas /
analyzed: de nas sngags pa bdag nyid rtsa ba'i gsang sngags ji lta ba bzhin du brjod pas bskul bas /
translated: Then, the mantrin himself, by reciting the root mantra just as it is, incites the weapon.

original: rang gi snying ga'i yi ge'i sa bon las 'od zer las mtshon cha ji 'dra ba de lta bur gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i yi ge'i sa bon las 'od zer las mtshon cha ji 'dra ba de lta bur gyur te /
translated: From the seed syllable at one's heart, light rays emanate in the form of weapons.

original: phyogs thams cad du 'phros pas sangs rgyas rnams la phog ste /🔽'od du gyur nas mtshon cha la 'dus te slar 'dus nas /
analyzed: phyogs thams cad du 'phros pas sangs rgyas rnams la phog ste / 'od du gyur nas mtshon cha la 'dus te slar 'dus nas /
translated: They spread out in all directions, striking the buddhas.🔽They become light and gather into the weapon.

original: mdun gyi mtshon cha la thim par bya'o //
analyzed: mdun gyi mtshon cha la thim par bya'o //
translated: Again gathering, they dissolve into the weapon in front.

original: 'di lta bu dang ldan pa'i bzlas brjod ji ltar dam bcas pa bzhin du byed pa ni mtshon cha sgrub pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu dang ldan pa'i bzlas brjod ji ltar dam bcas pa bzhin du byed pa ni mtshon cha sgrub pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: Recitation endowed with this, as promised, is the ritual of accomplishing the weapon.

original: gal te mtshan ma byung na ni rang gi lha la 'dud pa'i bsam pas mtshon cha de lag tu blangs pas dngos grub can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mtshan ma byung na ni rang gi lha la 'dud pa'i bsam pas mtshon cha de lag tu blangs pas dngos grub can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a sign arises, by taking up that weapon with the intention of bowing to one's deity, one becomes accomplished.

original: gal te mtshan ma ma byung na yang tha mal bar mi gzhag par ji lta ba bzhin du blangs te /
analyzed: gal te mtshan ma ma byung na yang tha mal bar mi gzhag par ji lta ba bzhin du blangs te /
translated: Even if a sign does not arise, one should not leave it ordinary, but take it up just as it is.

original: snod bzang por sbas la phyis las la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: snod bzang por sbas la phyis las la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Having hidden it in a good vessel, later one should employ it in the rite.

original: gal te de nyid kyi tshe las la sbyor bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid kyi tshe las la sbyor bar 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to employ it in the rite at that very time,

original: mtshan ma thob pa rnams kyis ni ;
analyzed: mtshan ma thob pa rnams kyis ni ;
translated: those who have obtained the signs

original: mtshon cha gzas pa tsam gyis las grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshon cha gzas pa tsam gyis las grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: will accomplish the rite merely by aiming with the weapon.

original: mtshan ma ma thob pa rnams kyis bya ba'i cho ga ni 'di yin ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma ma thob pa rnams kyis bya ba'i cho ga ni 'di yin ste /
translated: This is the rite for those who have not obtained the signs:

original: bsgrub bya'i rjes dang dri ma la sogs pa ji ltar rnyed pa'i rdzas rnams dang / dur khrod kyi sa dang thal ba rnams su sbyar te /
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i rjes dang dri ma la sogs pa ji ltar rnyed pa'i rdzas rnams dang / dur khrod kyi sa dang thal ba rnams su sbyar te /
translated: One should mix together the substances such as the hair and dirt of the victim, and the charnel ground soil and ash,

original: bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan sor brgyad pa zhig bya'o //🔽de'i @24a * //🔽nang du yang dug dang skye tshe dang / lan tshva dang / mi dang khyi'i khrag rnams sbyar te blugs par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan sor brgyad pa zhig bya'o // de'i @24a * // nang du yang dug dang skye tshe dang / lan tshva dang / mi dang khyi'i khrag rnams sbyar te blugs par bya'o //
translated: and make an effigy of the victim eight fingerbreadths in size.🔽One should fill it with the victim’s name and family, written on birchbark or paper,

original: ming dang rus kyang gro ba'am shog shog la bris te gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: ming dang rus kyang gro ba'am shog shog la bris te gzhag par bya'o //
translated: and with poison, arsenic, salt, and the blood of a human and a dog.

original: phyi rol du 'ang dur khrod kyi sol ba dang dug dang khrag gis bsku bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du 'ang dur khrod kyi sol ba dang dug dang khrag gis bsku bar bya'o //
translated: And externally, one should anoint it with charnel ground ash, poison, and blood.

original: de nas gzugs brnyan de skud pa nag po sa btags te mandala gyi dbus su gan rkyal du mgo lhor bstan te bzhag la dgug pa'i sbyor ba ji ltar nus pas bsgrub bya bkug ste /
analyzed: de nas gzugs brnyan de skud pa nag po sa btags te mandala gyi dbus su gan rkyal du mgo lhor bstan te bzhag la dgug pa'i sbyor ba ji ltar nus pas bsgrub bya bkug ste /
translated: Then, having tied the effigy with black thread, one should place it on its back in the center of the maṇḍala, facing south, and summon the victim with the application of the rite of summoning to the best of one's ability.

original: gzugs brnyan la phab ste gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la phab ste gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Having transferred [the victim] to the effigy, one should insert [the effigy].

original: de nas dbus kyi mtshon cha blangs te snying gar gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dbus kyi mtshon cha blangs te snying gar gdab par bya'o //
translated: Then, having taken the weapon in the center, one should strike the heart.

original: de bzhin du shar phyogs kyi blangs te dpral bar gdab bo //🔽lho phyogs kyi blangs te lte bar gdab bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du shar phyogs kyi blangs te dpral bar gdab bo // lho phyogs kyi blangs te lte bar gdab bo //
translated: Similarly, having taken the one in the east, one should strike the forehead.🔽Having taken the one in the south, one should strike the navel.

original: nub phyogs kyi blangs te mgrin par gdab po //
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi blangs te mgrin par gdab po //
translated: Having taken the one in the west, one should strike the throat.

original: byang phyogs kyi blangs te gsang gnas su gdab po //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi blangs te gsang gnas su gdab po //
translated: Having taken the one in the north, one should strike the secret place.

original: gal te dgu yod na ni lhag ma bzhi yan lag bzhi la gdab po //
analyzed: gal te dgu yod na ni lhag ma bzhi yan lag bzhi la gdab po //
translated: If there are nine, the remaining four should be struck on the four limbs.

original: tsher ma'i tshogs thams cad ni dbang po'i gnas thams cad dang / tshigs chen po rnams nas brtsams nas tshigs phra mo thams cad dang mthar lus ma lus par yongs su gang bar bya'o //
analyzed: tsher ma'i tshogs thams cad ni dbang po'i gnas thams cad dang / tshigs chen po rnams nas brtsams nas tshigs phra mo thams cad dang mthar lus ma lus par yongs su gang bar bya'o //
translated: All the masses of thorns are in all the sense bases, and beginning from the major joints, all the minor joints and finally the entire body are completely filled.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus sam phyi rol gyi grva'am /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus sam phyi rol gyi grva'am /
translated: Then, in the center of the maṇḍala or in the outer corners,

original: yang na ji ltar bde ba'i gnas shig tu dong gru gsum zhig brkos te /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar bde ba'i gnas shig tu dong gru gsum zhig brkos te /
translated: or else, in whatever place is comfortable, dig a triangular pit.

original: de'i nang du bud med kyi bhandha bkra mi shis pa zhig gi nang du bcug nas ;
analyzed: de'i nang du bud med kyi bhandha bkra mi shis pa zhig gi nang du bcug nas ;
translated: Place an inauspicious skull of a woman in the center of that.

original: skyes pa'i bhandha bkra mi shis pa zhig gis steng nas bkab ste /
analyzed: skyes pa'i bhandha bkra mi shis pa zhig gis steng nas bkab ste /
translated: Cover it with an inauspicious skull of a man.

original: dong de yang mgal dum dang tsher ma dang sol ba dang / rus pa sna tshogs brdungs pa'i dum bu dang / dug gi lo ma dang / smad 'tshong ma'i smad dkris dang / lam po che'i rdul rnams gyis bkang nas /
analyzed: dong de yang mgal dum dang tsher ma dang sol ba dang / rus pa sna tshogs brdungs pa'i dum bu dang / dug gi lo ma dang / smad 'tshong ma'i smad dkris dang / lam po che'i rdul rnams gyis bkang nas /
translated: Fill that pit with charcoal, thorns, ashes, various bone fragments, poisonous leaves, a prostitute’s used underwear, and road dust.

original: legs par sbas pa'i steng du sna tshogs rdo rje zhig bris te /
analyzed: legs par sbas pa'i steng du sna tshogs rdo rje zhig bris te /
translated: Draw a crossed vajra on top of the well-concealed pit.

original: de'i 'og tu sngags pa g-yas brkyang ba'i sbyor ba gnas nas gzir cing gsang sngags de nyid bzlas na gnad kyi gnas yongs su gzir bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sngags pa g-yas brkyang ba'i sbyor ba gnas nas gzir cing gsang sngags de nyid bzlas na gnad kyi gnas yongs su gzir bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, the mantrin, standing in the position of right-extended leg, should press down and recite that very mantra.

original: gang dang gang gi mi ldan pa de dang de thams cad brlag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dang gang gi mi ldan pa de dang de thams cad brlag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever is lacking in whatever way, all of that will be destroyed.

original: ji srid las grub par ma gyur pa de srid du sbyor ba gtang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid las grub par ma gyur pa de srid du sbyor ba gtang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Until the rite is accomplished, one should not give up the practice.

original: las grub par gyur nas de dag slar phyung ste /
analyzed: las grub par gyur nas de dag slar phyung ste /
translated: When the rite is accomplished, one should extract them.

original: phur bu'am rtsang la sogs pa'i mtshon cha rnams ni phyung la 'o mas bkrus te /
analyzed: phur bu'am rtsang la sogs pa'i mtshon cha rnams ni phyung la 'o mas bkrus te /
translated: The weapons such as the kīlas and the boundary-stakes should be extracted, washed with milk,

original: spyin sreg gis mchod nas gzhag go //
analyzed: spyin sreg gis mchod nas gzhag go //
translated: and placed after making an offering of burnt-offering.

original: ling+ga ni 'o mas bkrus la sdig pa sreg pa'i spyin sreg gam /
analyzed: ling+ga ni 'o mas bkrus la sdig pa sreg pa'i spyin sreg gam /
translated: The effigy should be washed with milk and burnt in a burnt-offering for the destruction of sin,

original: yang na chu klung du dor te bsod nams @24b spel pa'i las bya'o //
analyzed: yang na chu klung du dor te bsod nams @24b spel pa'i las bya'o //
translated: or else it should be cast into a river and one should perform the rite of increasing merit.

original: thod pa dang sol ba la sogs pa'i rdzas gzhan rnams ni phyi rol gyi gnas shig tu sbas te /
analyzed: thod pa dang sol ba la sogs pa'i rdzas gzhan rnams ni phyi rol gyi gnas shig tu sbas te /
translated: The other substances such as the skull and charcoal should be hidden in a place outside.

original: dus phyis dgos na de nyid nas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dus phyis dgos na de nyid nas blang bar bya'o //
translated: If it is needed later, one should take it from there.

original: dong de nyid sa bzang pos bkang ste gzhag go //
analyzed: dong de nyid sa bzang pos bkang ste gzhag go //
translated: That pit should be filled with good earth and left.

original: sbyor ba 'di lta bu legs par byas kyang rjes su bskul ba zla ba drug gis kyang las grub par ma gyur na /
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di lta bu legs par byas kyang rjes su bskul ba zla ba drug gis kyang las grub par ma gyur na /
translated: Even if this kind of application is well done, if the rite is not accomplished even in six months of urging,

original: sgrub pa po'i dad pa dang rtsol ba la nyes pa yod pa'am /
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i dad pa dang rtsol ba la nyes pa yod pa'am /
translated: there is a fault in the faith and effort of the practitioner,

original: yang na bsgrub bya'i rgyud la bsod nams kyi nus pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: yang na bsgrub bya'i rgyud la bsod nams kyi nus pa yod pa ste /
translated: or else there is the power of merit in the continuum of the victim.

original: de lta bu dag la zla ba drug cing sbyor ba 'di lta bu re bsnan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dag la zla ba drug cing sbyor ba 'di lta bu re bsnan par bya'o //
translated: In such cases, one should add this kind of application for each six months.

original: gsang sngags ni rtsa ba'i gsang sngags nyid kyi rjes su che ge mo m'a ra ya phat phat /
analyzed: gsang sngags ni rtsa ba'i gsang sngags nyid kyi rjes su che ge mo m'a ra ya phat phat /
translated: The mantra is the root mantra itself, after which one adds “so-and-so die, die!”

original: ces bya ba bskul ba 'ba' zhig mtshon cha thams cad la thun mong du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba bskul ba 'ba' zhig mtshon cha thams cad la thun mong du 'gyur ro //
translated: This urging alone is common to all weapons.

original: las 'di'i dus su yang dus drug dang bzhi'am re rer yang mchod pa dang gtor ma spyin pa dang / dkon mchog la thugs dam bskul zhing spyi dang khyad par gyi srung ma rnams la phrin las bcol ba ni las kyi grogs su 'gyur te las myur du grub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: las 'di'i dus su yang dus drug dang bzhi'am re rer yang mchod pa dang gtor ma spyin pa dang / dkon mchog la thugs dam bskul zhing spyi dang khyad par gyi srung ma rnams la phrin las bcol ba ni las kyi grogs su 'gyur te las myur du grub par byed pa'o //
translated: At the time of this rite, one should make offerings and give sacrificial cakes in each of the six or four times, and one should invoke the Three Jewels and entrust the activities to the general and special protectors. This will assist the rite and cause the rite to be quickly accomplished.

original: gnad kyi gnas rnams yongs su gzir ba zhes bya ba'i cho gas gdug pa 'dul ba'i sbyor ba bstan pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gnad kyi gnas rnams yongs su gzir ba zhes bya ba'i cho gas gdug pa 'dul ba'i sbyor ba bstan pa rdzogs so /
translated: The teaching of the application of subduing the wicked by means of the rite called “pressing down on the vital points” is complete.

original: // / byug dang gtor ba la sogs kyis //🔽rul sogs ma rung bya ba yis //
analyzed: // / byug dang gtor ba la sogs kyis // rul sogs ma rung bya ba yis //
translated: By means of anointment, sprinkling, and so forth,🔽the application of causing corruption, such as rotting,

original: sbyor ba bstan pa gang yin de //
analyzed: sbyor ba bstan pa gang yin de //
translated: is taught.

original: bde bar 'dir ni bstan par bya'o //🔽dug dang ma mo'i gdon la sogs //
analyzed: bde bar 'dir ni bstan par bya'o // dug dang ma mo'i gdon la sogs //
translated: That will be taught here for happiness.🔽Some, such as the poison and mamo spirits,

original: phra men la sogs kha cig ni //🔽dug dang kha rlangs dri ma sogs //
analyzed: phra men la sogs kha cig ni // dug dang kha rlangs dri ma sogs //
translated: the rākṣasas, and so forth,

original: bsgos pa'i rdzas kyis reg byas na //
analyzed: bsgos pa'i rdzas kyis reg byas na //
translated: are affected by substances tainted by poison, breath, and so forth,🔽and by being touched by substances.

original: rul sogs yan lag ma rung byed //
analyzed: rul sogs yan lag ma rung byed //
translated: The limbs are corrupted by rotting, and so forth.

original: bsgrub pa gsang sngags mthar ldan pa //
analyzed: bsgrub pa gsang sngags mthar ldan pa //
translated: The practice is endowed with the mantra at the end.

original: de dag bskul ba'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: de dag bskul ba'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the application of inciting them,

original: yan lag ma rung byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: yan lag ma rung byed par 'gyur //
translated: the limbs will be rendered useless.🔽The concise ritual of that

original: de yi cho ga bsdus pa dag / bde bar 'dir ni bstan par bya //
analyzed: de yi cho ga bsdus pa dag / bde bar 'dir ni bstan par bya //
translated: is taught here for the sake of happiness.🔽Blood and poison should be placed

original: khrag dang dug tu ldan pa dag / mandala dbus su gzhag par bya //
analyzed: khrag dang dug tu ldan pa dag / mandala dbus su gzhag par bya //
translated: in the center of the maṇḍala.

original: yi ge ru dang kha ldan pa'i //
analyzed: yi ge ru dang kha ldan pa'i //
translated: The substances endowed with the syllables ru and kha

original: rdzas ni rab tu gzhag par bya //🔽glang po phag dang ma he yi //
analyzed: rdzas ni rab tu gzhag par bya // glang po phag dang ma he yi //
translated: should be well-placed.🔽The liver of an elephant, pig, and buffalo,

original: mchin pa dug dang sbyar ba la //🔽nag po'i 'bru dang sbyar byas nas //
analyzed: mchin pa dug dang sbyar ba la // nag po'i 'bru dang sbyar byas nas //
translated: mixed with poison,🔽should be mixed with black grains

original: dur khrod sol bas bsku bar bya //
analyzed: dur khrod sol bas bsku bar bya //
translated: and smeared with charnel ground ash.

original: gzhan yang yungs kar dag la yang //
analyzed: gzhan yang yungs kar dag la yang //
translated: Moreover, mustard seeds

original: dug gis bsgos pa gzhag par bya //
analyzed: dug gis bsgos pa gzhag par bya //
translated: should be placed, smeared with poison.🔽Blood, poison, black mustard,🔽iron filings, vajra, and so forth,

original: khrag dang dug dang ske tshe dang // lcags phye rdo rje la sogs dang // nag po'i 'bru dang sbyar ba yi //
analyzed: khrag dang dug dang ske tshe dang // lcags phye rdo rje la sogs dang // nag po'i 'bru dang sbyar ba yi //
translated: mixed with black grains,

original: gtor ma dag kyang gzhag par bya //🔽seng ge stag dang wa la sogs //🔽@25a * // bya rgod 'ug pa la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: gtor ma dag kyang gzhag par bya // seng ge stag dang wa la sogs // @25a * // bya rgod 'ug pa la sogs pa'i //
translated: should be placed as bali offerings.🔽The arrows of🔽the hair or feathers of🔽lions, tigers, foxes, and so forth,

original: spu 'am 'dab ma ldan pa'i mda' //
analyzed: spu 'am 'dab ma ldan pa'i mda' //
translated: vultures, owls, and so forth,

original: bcu drug dag kyang gzhag par bya //
analyzed: bcu drug dag kyang gzhag par bya //
translated: And also the sixteen should be placed.

original: khro bo'i sngags kyis gzir byas pa'i //
analyzed: khro bo'i sngags kyis gzir byas pa'i //
translated: Having oppressed with the mantra of the wrathful one,🔽The mantras of the duga and the mamos,

original: du ga dang ma mo'i sngags dag dang // phra man sngags dang sbyar byas te //
analyzed: du ga dang ma mo'i sngags dag dang // phra man sngags dang sbyar byas te //
translated: And having combined with the mantra of the phra min,

original: gdu ga pa gang na gnas pa der //
analyzed: gdu ga pa gang na gnas pa der //
translated: Wherever the duga is located,

original: gtor zhing 'phangs na ma rung 'gyur //
analyzed: gtor zhing 'phangs na ma rung 'gyur //
translated: Scattering and casting, it will become unfit.

original: de la byug pa dang gtor ba'i rdzas kyis bsgrub bya'i lus 'drul ba la sogs pa dang / sgo kun nas ma rung par 'gyur ba'i thabs kyi cho ga bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la byug pa dang gtor ba'i rdzas kyis bsgrub bya'i lus 'drul ba la sogs pa dang / sgo kun nas ma rung par 'gyur ba'i thabs kyi cho ga bshad par bya ste /
translated: There, the method ritual of the substances for anointing and scattering that cause the body of the victim to rot, and so forth, and the method of making all the doors unfit will be explained.

original: dang por bsgom pa dang bzlas pa'i sgo nas sngon du legs par bsnyen pa byas la /
analyzed: dang por bsgom pa dang bzlas pa'i sgo nas sngon du legs par bsnyen pa byas la /
translated: First, having performed the proper preliminary service through meditation and recitation,

original: mar gyi ngo la dur khrod la sogs par song ste /
analyzed: mar gyi ngo la dur khrod la sogs par song ste /
translated: on the waning [fortnight], go to a charnel ground, and so forth.

original: der mandala gru gsum zhig byas nas khrag sna tshogs dang dug gis bran par bya'o //
analyzed: der mandala gru gsum zhig byas nas khrag sna tshogs dang dug gis bran par bya'o //
translated: There, having made a triangular maṇḍala, smear it with various kinds of blood and poison.

original: de'i dbus su khrag sna tshogs dang / bod bu dang ba long gi dri chu dang / dug sna tshogs dang sbyar ba'i chu dang de rnams gcig tu sbyar ba bre bdun nam bcu bzhi 'am nyi shu rtsa gcig zangs kyi snod du blugs te de'i khar bal sngon po dang dmar po bsres pas kha rab rib tsam du gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su khrag sna tshogs dang / bod bu dang ba long gi dri chu dang / dug sna tshogs dang sbyar ba'i chu dang de rnams gcig tu sbyar ba bre bdun nam bcu bzhi 'am nyi shu rtsa gcig zangs kyi snod du blugs te de'i khar bal sngon po dang dmar po bsres pas kha rab rib tsam du gcad par bya'o //
translated: In the center of that, put seven, fourteen, or twenty-one measures of water mixed with various bloods, the urine of a Tibetan boy or a blind person, and various poisons, all mixed together in a copper vessel. Cover it with a piece of blue and red wool, just barely covering the top.

original: de'i phyi rol du glang po che'i mchin pa dang / phag gi mchin pa dang / me he'i mchin pa dang / dug sna tshogs dang sbyar ba dang / 'bru nag po legs par btags pa'i phyi dang sbyar nas de las gru gsum sor bzhi pa brgya rtsa brgyad byas te /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du glang po che'i mchin pa dang / phag gi mchin pa dang / me he'i mchin pa dang / dug sna tshogs dang sbyar ba dang / 'bru nag po legs par btags pa'i phyi dang sbyar nas de las gru gsum sor bzhi pa brgya rtsa brgyad byas te /
translated: Outside of that, put the liver of an elephant, the liver of a pig, the liver of a goat, mixed with various poisons, and the outer [part of] black grain, all mixed together. From that, make one hundred and eight four-finger-widths of the triangular [shape].

original: dur khrod kyi sol bas nag por bskul la 'og ngos su yi ge ru dmar po bris te /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi sol bas nag por bskul la 'og ngos su yi ge ru dmar po bris te /
translated: Heat them with charnel ground ash until they are black, and on the underside write the syllable ru with red [mercury].

original: dug thams cad kyi rten khrag me long tsam rer 'gyur bar bsgom mo //
analyzed: dug thams cad kyi rten khrag me long tsam rer 'gyur bar bsgom mo //
translated: Meditate that all the poisons transform into blood the size of a mirror.

original: steng gi dbus su dug thams cad kyi snying po yi ge kha nag po bris te dug nag po me ltar 'bar bar bsgom mo //
analyzed: steng gi dbus su dug thams cad kyi snying po yi ge kha nag po bris te dug nag po me ltar 'bar bar bsgom mo //
translated: In the center above, write the syllable kha, the essence of all poisons, black in color, and meditate on black poison blazing like fire.🔽In the three corners, write the poison mantra viṣa in each one and place them.

original: gru gsum du dug gi ming gi sngags bi sha zhes bya ba re re bris la gzhag / de'i phyi rim du yungs kar dug dang khrag gis bsgos pa bya gag gi sgo nga tsam gyis kham pa'i snod kyi nang du blugs te brgya rtsa brgyad kyis bskor
analyzed: gru gsum du dug gi ming gi sngags bi sha zhes bya ba re re bris la gzhag / de'i phyi rim du yungs kar dug dang khrag gis bsgos pa bya gag gi sgo nga tsam gyis kham pa'i snod kyi nang du blugs te brgya rtsa brgyad kyis bskor
translated: Around that, place a copper vessel filled with white mustard seeds dyed with poison and blood, the size of a hen's egg, surrounded by one hundred and eight.🔽Around that, place eight wrathful bali offerings filled with black grain beer, poison, black nightshade, salt, iron filings, and stone filings, covered with poison leaves.

original: te gzhag / de'i phyi rim du drag po'i gtor ma brgyad 'bru nag po'i chan dang dug dang ske tshe dang lan tshva dang / lcags phye dang rdo phye rnams blugs te dug gi lo mas kha bcad la gzhag / de'i phyir rim du gshin rje'i rgyal po 'khor gyi phra men ma bcu drug tu byin gyis brlabs pa'i mda' bcu drug rang rang gi pags pa spu dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: te gzhag / de'i phyi rim du drag po'i gtor ma brgyad 'bru nag po'i chan dang dug dang ske tshe dang lan tshva dang / lcags phye dang rdo phye rnams blugs te dug gi lo mas kha bcad la gzhag / de'i phyir rim du gshin rje'i rgyal po 'khor gyi phra men ma bcu drug tu byin gyis brlabs pa'i mda' bcu drug rang rang gi pags pa spu dang bcas pa dang /
translated: Around that, place sixteen arrows blessed as the sixteen female piśācīs of the retinue of King Yama, each with their own skin and fur.

original: 'dab gshog gis bsgron pa mde'u'i sbu gur yungs kar @25b la dug gi sngags dang / phra men ma rang rang gi snying po bzlas pa blugs te shing gdug pa las byas pa'i mde'u dbyibs gru gsum dug dang khrag gis bskus pa bcug ste phyogs mtshams brgyad du gzhag / phyogs bzhir gzhu bzhi dang mi ro'i skra las byas pa'i 'khrul 'khor bzhi yang
analyzed: 'dab gshog gis bsgron pa mde'u'i sbu gur yungs kar @25b la dug gi sngags dang / phra men ma rang rang gi snying po bzlas pa blugs te shing gdug pa las byas pa'i mde'u dbyibs gru gsum dug dang khrag gis bskus pa bcug ste phyogs mtshams brgyad du gzhag / phyogs bzhir gzhu bzhi dang mi ro'i skra las byas pa'i 'khrul 'khor bzhi yang
translated: In the four directions one should place the four bows and the four magical devices made from the hair of a corpse.

original: gzhag go // srog chags kyi pags pa 'am 'dab ma ma rnyed pa dag ni shin shun la sogs pa la phra men ma'i ming bris te snga ma bzhin du bsgron par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhag go // srog chags kyi pags pa 'am 'dab ma ma rnyed pa dag ni shin shun la sogs pa la phra men ma'i ming bris te snga ma bzhin du bsgron par bya'o //
translated: Those for which one has not obtained the skin of an animal or a feather, one should write the name of the yakṣiṇī on birch bark and so forth, and fill it as before.

original: de nas sngags pa bdag nyid gos nag po gyon skra lhug par bshig / lag pa khrag gis byugs te kha lho phyogs su bltas nas /
analyzed: de nas sngags pa bdag nyid gos nag po gyon skra lhug par bshig / lag pa khrag gis byugs te kha lho phyogs su bltas nas /
translated: Then the mantrin himself should don black garments, dishevel his hair, smear his hands with blood, and face south.

original: snga ma bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi rnal 'byor bsgoms te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi rnal 'byor bsgoms te /
translated: Having meditated on the maṇḍala yoga as before,

original: dang por bcom ldan 'das gshin rje gshed po sngon bzhin du legs par mchod nas /
analyzed: dang por bcom ldan 'das gshin rje gshed po sngon bzhin du legs par mchod nas /
translated: First, having made offerings to Bhagavat Yamântaka as before,

original: de nas dug dang ma mo dang phra men ma rnams la yang gtor ma bzang po byin te dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dug dang ma mo dang phra men ma rnams la yang gtor ma bzang po byin te dga' bar bya'o //
translated: then one should give good sacrificial cakes to the poisons, mātṛkās, and piśācas, and please them.

original: de nas bdag gi mdun du mi thod kyi nang du yungs kar dang ske tshes dkang ste bzhag nas bdag nyid lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas khros te rtsa ba'i gsang sngags bzlas pa'i yungs kar gyis rdzas de dag thams cad la gtor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bdag gi mdun du mi thod kyi nang du yungs kar dang ske tshes dkang ste bzhag nas bdag nyid lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas khros te rtsa ba'i gsang sngags bzlas pa'i yungs kar gyis rdzas de dag thams cad la gtor bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having placed mustard seed and asafoetida in a human skull in front of oneself, one should be endowed with the yoga of the deity, and, wrathful, scatter those substances with mustard seed enchanted with the root mantra.🔽Then, after the root mantra, one should make the essence syllables of all poisons, the syllable ru,🔽the essence syllable of poison itself, the syllable kha,

original: de nas rtsa ba'i gsang sngags kyi rjes su dug thams cad kyi rten gyi snying po yi ge ru zhes bya ba dang / dug nyid kyi snying po'i yi ge kha zhes bya ba dang / dug gi ming gi sngags so sor byas te /
analyzed: de nas rtsa ba'i gsang sngags kyi rjes su dug thams cad kyi rten gyi snying po yi ge ru zhes bya ba dang / dug nyid kyi snying po'i yi ge kha zhes bya ba dang / dug gi ming gi sngags so sor byas te /
translated: and the mantra of the name of the poison, individually.

original: dug gzhug pa'i snying po dang bcas te spel nas yungs kar la bsngags te rdzas de dag thams cad la gtor bar bya'o //
analyzed: dug gzhug pa'i snying po dang bcas te spel nas yungs kar la bsngags te rdzas de dag thams cad la gtor bar bya'o //
translated: Having increased it with the essence of the poison, one should recite over white mustard seeds and scatter all those substances.

original: de nas ma mo dang phra men ma'i sngags kyang rtsa ba'i gsang sngags kyis gzir cing bzlas te gtor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ma mo dang phra men ma'i sngags kyang rtsa ba'i gsang sngags kyis gzir cing bzlas te gtor bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should also scatter the mantras of the mātṛkā and piśācī, having suppressed them with the root mantra.

original: de yang khrag gi snod du ni ma mo rnams kyi snying po rtsa ba'i sngags kyis gzir ba yungs kar la bzlas shing blugs par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang khrag gi snod du ni ma mo rnams kyi snying po rtsa ba'i sngags kyis gzir ba yungs kar la bzlas shing blugs par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, in the case of the blood vessel, one should pour in the essence of the mātṛkās, having suppressed it with the root mantra, and recite over the white mustard seeds.

original: phra men ma'i snying po rtsa ba'i sngags kyis gzir ba ni mda' rnams la bsngags pa bya'o //
analyzed: phra men ma'i snying po rtsa ba'i sngags kyis gzir ba ni mda' rnams la bsngags pa bya'o //
translated: The essence of the piśācīs, having suppressed it with the root mantra, should be recited over the arrows.

original: yungs kar dang gtor ma la ni rtsa ba'i gsang sngags 'ba' zhig bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: yungs kar dang gtor ma la ni rtsa ba'i gsang sngags 'ba' zhig bzlas par bya'o //
translated: In the case of the white mustard seeds and the bali offering, one should recite only the root mantra.

original: dug ni rdzas thams cad la khyab par bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: dug ni rdzas thams cad la khyab par bzla bar bya'o //
translated: The poison should be recited pervading all the substances.

original: de la rtsa ba'i sngags kyis gzir bar bya ba'i dug gi sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i sngags kyis gzir bar bya ba'i dug gi sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The mantra of the poison to be suppressed with the root mantra is as follows:

original: rtsa ba'i sngags kyi rjes su bi sha r'u p'i sha kha pra be sha ya phat phat /🔽ces bya ba 'di yin no //🔽rtsa ba'i sngags kyis gzir cing bskul ba'i ma mo'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sngags kyi rjes su bi sha r'u p'i sha kha pra be sha ya phat phat / ces bya ba 'di yin no // rtsa ba'i sngags kyis gzir cing bskul ba'i ma mo'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: viśvarūpaśakhaprabheśaya phaṭ phaṭ.

original: rtsa ba'i @26a * //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i @26a * //

analyzed: aom bi shva d'a ki ni pra t'itstsha man bi lim h'um phat /

original: de nas bsreg pa'i cho ga yang //
analyzed: de nas bsreg pa'i cho ga yang //

analyzed: yang na lag pa bzhin @28a * //

original: bal nag po dang dkar po log par bsgril ba'i skud pa gro'i mgrin pa tsam gyi tshad du bkal ba srang gsum tsam zhig byas te /

original: gro ga 'am shog shog la gsang sngags spel ba bris nas /

analyzed: khrig gi mandala gru gsum gyi steng du gzhag par bya'o //

analyzed: de nas bdag nyid lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas mchod pa byas nas /

translated: Those light rays summon the mātṛkā called “witch” from the ten directions, who are in the form of a black woman holding a ball of thread in her hand, and also the graha called “witch” who are various colors and hold a ball of thread in their hand.

original: de nas bzlas pa gtong bar 'dod pa dang / gdon de dag la gtor ma byin te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bkas byad ces bya ba'i gdon khyed rnams 'dir brtan par 'dug la /

original: nga'i gtor ma yang blangs te dga' bar gyis /
analyzed: nga'i gtor ma yang blangs te dga' bar gyis /

analyzed: yang na der 'jug pa'i lam dag tu sba bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, one should hide it in the paths leading there.
